controller

Class LDController

  • java.lang.Object
    • controller.LDController

  • public class LDController
extends java.lang.Object
    LDController is responsible for connecting listeners in the LaserDisc.fxml file to variables in the LaserDiscCollection class. LDController is also responsible for updaating the laserdisc.txt file to be user for LaserDisc.fxml's TableView.

    • Constructor Detail

      • LDController

        public LDController()

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public void initialize()
        initialize initializes the cells in the TableView to their respective variables in the LaserDiscCollection. initialize also pre-populates the TableView with the variables in LaserDisc.txt.

      • backButtonHandle

        public void backButtonHandle()
        backButtonHandle is responsible for returning to Collectibase's main screen and writes any new entered information to LaserDisc.txt before exiting.

      • updateButtonHandle

        public void updateButtonHandle()
        updateButtonHandle is responsible for updating the TableView and LaserDisc.txt file whenever pressed.

      • insertButtonHandle

        public void insertButtonHandle()
        insertButtonHandle is responsible for inserting any text in the text friends onto the TableView. Empty fields are also accounted for. After the fields have been inserted they are cleared and LaserDisc.txt is updated.

      • deleteButtonHandle

        public void deleteButtonHandle()
        deleteButtonHandle deletes a selected field or row from the TableView. LaserDisc.txt is also updated by deleting the respective fields from the file.

      • cellValueFactory

        public void cellValueFactory()
        cellValueFactory is responsible for connecting the variable columns with it's respective variable in LaserDiscCollection. cellValueFactory also allows for a single cell to be edited by the user when double clicked.

      • changeTitleName

        public void changeTitleName(javafx.scene.control.TableColumn.CellEditEvent<LaserDiscCollection,java.lang.String> edditedCell)
        The methods below update a single variable of the collectible when it's cell is double clicked.
        Parameters:
        edditedCell: - the cell that was edited in the TableView will be the variable that is changed in the collection.

      • changeGenre

        public void changeGenre(javafx.scene.control.TableColumn.CellEditEvent<LaserDiscCollection,java.lang.String> edditedCell1)

      • changeFormat

        public void changeFormat(javafx.scene.control.TableColumn.CellEditEvent<LaserDiscCollection,java.lang.String> edditedCell)

      • changeYear

        public void changeYear(javafx.scene.control.TableColumn.CellEditEvent<LaserDiscCollection,java.lang.String> edditedCell)

      • changeDirector

        public void changeDirector(javafx.scene.control.TableColumn.CellEditEvent<LaserDiscCollection,java.lang.String> edditedCell)

      • changeSpecialEdition

        public void changeSpecialEdition(javafx.scene.control.TableColumn.CellEditEvent<LaserDiscCollection,java.lang.String> edditedCell)

      • changeEncodingFormat

        public void changeEncodingFormat(javafx.scene.control.TableColumn.CellEditEvent<LaserDiscCollection,java.lang.String> edditedCell)

      • changeCriterion

        public void changeCriterion(javafx.scene.control.TableColumn.CellEditEvent<LaserDiscCollection,java.lang.String> edditedCell)

      • changeSpineNumber

        public void changeSpineNumber(javafx.scene.control.TableColumn.CellEditEvent<LaserDiscCollection,java.lang.String> edditedCell)

      • changeSpecialFeaturing

        public void changeSpecialFeaturing(javafx.scene.control.TableColumn.CellEditEvent<LaserDiscCollection,java.lang.String> edditedCell)

      • writeLDFile

        public void writeLDFile()
                 throws java.lang.Exception
        writeLDFile is responsible for writing to the LaserDisc.txt file in order to frequently update the TableView.
        Throws:
        Exception: - In the case that the collection has not been previously created, the LaserDisc.txt file is not found.
        java.lang.Exception
